pain_points_original.title: Stringent Security & Government Compliance Burden
pain_points_original.description: The solution must meet Australia's highest government security standards, including IRAP PROTECTED certification, data sovereignty, and Essential Eight, to handle highly sensitive legal information.
source_references: RFI1-2025 AI legal tools - Attachment A - Non-Functional Requirements.xlsx.pdf page 3
RFI1-2025 AI legal tools - Attachment A - Non-Functional Requirements.xlsx.pdf page 5

pain_points_original.title: Lawyer Inefficiency on Repetitive Tasks
pain_points_original.description: Lawyers spend excessive time on low-value, repetitive work like document summarisation, discovery, and initial drafting, limiting capacity for high-value strategic legal analysis and client advice.

pain_points_original.title: Unacceptable Risk of "Black Box" AI
pain_points_original.description: As a government legal service, AI outputs must be transparent, explainable, and ethically sound. "Black box" solutions with unexplainable reasoning present a major legal and reputational risk.
source_references: RFI1-2025 AI legal tools - Attachment A - Non-Functional Requirements.xlsx.pdf page 3
RFI1-2025 AI legal tools - Attachment A - Non-Functional Requirements.xlsx.pdf page 9

pain_points_original.title: Disruption to Critical, Established Workflows
pain_points_original.description: New AI tools must seamlessly integrate with core legal systems (iManage, Elite 3E, MS Office) to supplement, not replace, existing capabilities and avoid disrupting established workflows and creating data silos.

pain_points_original.title: Need to Future-Proof with Advanced AI
pain_points_original.description: AGS is concerned about adopting a solution that will quickly become outdated. They seek not just current generative AI, but emerging "agentic AI" capable of autonomous, multi-step task execution.
